result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 9/25/15 Plea and Sentencing
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-25-2015 10:30 am
Writ
writ
Writ

11:14 am case called along with 14CF334.  Defendant Davis B. Drake in court, in custody with attorney David Zarwell.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's motion to join the 14CF385 case which is assigned to Br. 4, combined with this Branch 3 date and hear both cases at once, as currently scheduled.  State gave its argument to combine to favor judicial economy.  Exhibit #1 was marked and received.   Attorney Zarwell argued.  Motion granted.  Attorney Zarwell and Defendant stipulate to receiving the Motion concerning DNA evidence personally today rather than by mail.  Motions and other trial related issues were scheduled.
Motion hearing at 10-29-2015 01:30 pm
of intent to introduce DNA evidence
Telephone scheduling conference on May 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on April 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
State
Order on Arraignment

Defendant Davis B. Drake in court, in custody with attorney David Zarwell.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Sgt. Smedema, sworn & testifies; witness ID's def; State rests; def rests; parties heard; Court finds prob cause;   Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Per JA - 
Contacted SPD. Atty Zarwell was appointed. Video Appearance cancelled with Stanley Correctional.

Defendant Davis B. Drake in custody via video.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. appears from DCI via video; this is review hearing; Def. heard - applied with public defender's office and he has been approved; Court calls SPD office; SPD office notes that Def. has Matthew Weil on 2 other cases; Court will reset this RH for next week to make sure SPD will appoint
PA bond returned - defendant did not sign
Signature Bond Returned - Defendant refused to sign
Writ
Writ
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with N.J.F.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

1:17 - Defendant Davis B. Drake in court, in custody w/o counsel via video from DCI.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim N.J.F.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.
